node.title: Thousands of students skip NCEA exams after months of lockdown
node.description: Students in Auckland, Northland and parts of Waikato automatically get an unexpected event grade for any NCEA exams they miss.

node.title: Wellington lashed by heavy rain bringing surface flooding on roads, delays for commuters
node.description: Heavy rain has lashed Wellington bringing surface flooding on roads and delays for commuters, with 90mm of rain expected by this afternoon.

node.title: U.S. Military Has Acted Against Ransomware Groups, General Acknowledges
node.description: Gen. Paul M. Nakasone, the head of Cyber Command, said a new cross-functional effort has been gathering intelligence to combat criminal groups targeting U.S. infrastructure.

node.title: Hackers Nab $150M as BitMart Crypto Exchange Reports 'Large-Scale Security Breach'
node.description: BitMart temporarily suspended all withdrawals until further notice after it lost millions worth of crypto in a hacking incident.

node.title: Proof: Watch Guyon Espiner's alcohol documentary
node.description: Blackouts, bad hangovers and even an embarrassing incident with Helen Clark wasn't enough to stop Guyon Espiner drinking, but two years ago he finally quit the booze.

node.title: Teen dies in hospital after carpark assault, homicide investigation launched
node.description: A Christchurch teenager has died in hospital following an assault in the early hours of Saturday morning.

node.title: 'Stratospheric' housing market confidence unshaken by measures to cool prices - ASB
node.description: Unstoppable confidence in the housing market continues despite measures to cool price growth.

node.title: Gottlieb says WHO could be playing a role in "global leadership"
node.description: "It's largely a political body. It's not on the ground," Gottlieb told "Face the Nation."

node.title: Vivek Murthy Denies U.S. Back 'at Square One' Amid Omicron, Notes Holiday Travel OK
node.description: Those who are vaccinated, get tested before traveling, or gather in well-ventilated spaces and use masks carry a low risk of spreading the virus, Murthy said.

node.title: Beware the buy now, pay later 'debt spiral'. Experts warn it'll be haunting us long after Christmas
node.description: Are you using buy now, pay later services to buy your Christmas gifts this year? You could be in for a bad debt hangover, financial counsellors warn.

node.title: The Earth is getting a black box recorder, and it's already starting listening
node.description: A giant steel box is about to begin recording everything we say and do about climate change, for the benefit of ours and future civilisations.

node.title: What if everything we think we know about the origins of the Omicron variant is wrong?
node.description: When two flights from South Africa landed in Amsterdam last week, authorities scrambled to prevent the import of a new COVID-19 variant. But Omicron has already been lurking in the Netherlands for days.

node.title: NZ small firms ramp up spending on online business
node.description: Small firms are spending 25 percent more on ICT compared to pre-pandemic levels.

node.title: NZ shipping faces uneven playing field in NZ waters -report
node.description: New Zealand's shipping sector is an uneven playing field, and some big problems need fixing if resilience and environmental goals are to be met.

node.title: Covid-19: Nurses' online ICU training varies widely between DHBs
node.description: There are huge differences across country in the number of nurses doing the training the government says will keep ICUs going when Covid-19 surges.

node.title: Ilhan Omar Confident Pelosi Will Take Action Against Boebert for 'Anti-Muslim Rhetoric'
node.description: Ilhan Omar also called House Minority leader Kevin McCarthy a "coward" and a "liar" for not condemning Boebert's remarks.

node.title: Daughter Hid Mom's Corpse for Half a Year to Collect Social Security Checks: Police
node.description: Officers used a search warrant to enter her home and find the body after other relatives reported their concerns.

node.title: Bob Dole, former US senator and Republican presidential nominee, dies aged 98
node.description: The former US presidential nominee was diagnosed with advanced lung cancer in February and died in his sleep.

node.title: Breakers coach ready to return
node.description: New Zealand Breakers coach Dan Shamir has recovered from Covid-19 and will return to team training after a two week absence.

node.title: Ken Moffett, Top Federal Mediator and Union Official, Dies at 90
node.description: In the busy summer of 1981, he mediated labor disputes involving baseball players, postal workers and air traffic controllers. He later briefly ran the players’ union.

node.title: Britain and Denmark report a rise in known Omicron cases.
node.description: The nations are widely perceived as leaders in genomic sequencing and testing, giving them an edge over tracking the spread of the virus and its mutations.

node.title: Bob Dole Tributes Pour in After Former GOP Senator Dies at 98
node.description: "Senator Dole was an American hero, a statesman of the highest order & one of the greatest legislators of all time," wrote U.S. Senator Roger Marshall.

node.title: Mississippi to Get Near-Total Ban on Abortions if Roe v. Wade Overturned: Gov. Reeves
node.description: The state ban would automatically take effect if the case is overturned and prohibit all abortions except in cases of rape or to save the life of a mother.

node.title: Bob Dole, World War II veteran, senator and presidential nominee, has died at 98
node.description: Republican presidential nominee who lost to Bill Clinton in 1996 was last of White House contenders to serve in World War II.

node.title: Transcript: Maria Van Kerkhove on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Maria Van Kerkhove, WHO COVID-19 technical lead, that aired December 5, 2021 on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Bob Dole, Old Soldier and Stalwart of the Senate, Dies at 98
node.description: Mr. Dole, a son of the Kansas prairie who was left for dead on a World War II battlefield, became one of the longest-serving Republican leaders.

node.title: RNZ’s Tahi -'the one' for rangatahi?
node.description: Mediawatch: RNZ's previous plan to reach younger people collapsed last year, but this week it fired up Tahi - a more modest effort for the underserved youth audience. What's the plan this time? Audio

node.title: Transcript: Governor Ned Lamont on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Connecticut Governor Ned Lamont that aired Sunday, December 5, 2021, on "Face the Nation."

node.title: Transcript: Francis deSouza on "Face the Nation"
node.description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Illumina CEO Francis deSouza on Sunday, December 5, 2021.

node.title: Review: An Ambitious Project Returns at the Philharmonic
node.description: Project 19, the orchestra’s series commissioning female composers, came back with a new work by Joan Tower.
